attrs.text: | How to fill out the table below:

content.text: Each event gets 1 row. An event is a unique combination of action + actionSubject, like "created + issue" for Jira or "viewed + conversation" for Stride.

Note: You may want to break up the same event into different rows, since the same behaviour can be done from different pages/screens in the product. I've put an example of this in the table below; note that the different pages/screens correspond to the 'source' field below, as you can see 0a, 0b, and 0c are all the same createdIssue event, but can be done from the createIssueModals, board, or jiraImportModal.
('Page' events and uiViewed events will be automatically registered/included in the minimum spec as part of the instrumentation)
Note: read what types of events we'll be instrumenting in Event Types.
List the sources and related container and object types in bullet lists to improve readability. You should know the main Objects and Containers for your product.
The most popular Objects and Containers are listed at
, though we're trying to compile a comprehensive list.
"action" is what the user is doing e.g. create
"actionSubject" is the object of the action e.g. issue
"source" is where the action takes place (page/screen/other) e.g. projectConfig
(NOTE: please try to align with common design terminology for the product. If the terminology is not known or not widely used, include a screenshot or talk to a designer!)
"attributes" additional information that the event should capture e.g. requestTypeId, or status
Implemented is status whether this event has been implemented by a developer
Shipped is status whether this event is live
Cleaning up behavioural analytics - Data Integrity VTFM
FY18 Data VTFM - Quality Analytics Stream
Product Analytics Pipeline - Moving away from Segment
Clean Analytics Events: Why and How?
Attributes that are applied to all Editor analytics events

nodeCount allows us to understand which features different documents use.

This menu only exists in the mobile hybrid editor.
This menu has formatting styles (bold, italic, etc), headings, lists, and indentation
The “+” menu on web and mobile hybrid editors
This brings up the emoji picker, it can be dismissed so an emoji may not be inserted. If it is actually inserted it, there will be a track event below.
Mobile only, the native photo library
Mobile only, the native file picker
atlassian.editor.quickinsert.query (first time quick insert opens only)
This event is just when the prop is detected as being updated in the editor, there will be more events related to full-width mode which will be fired from Confluence

: when the emoji is inserted by selecting it from the inline emoji typeahead
: when the emoji is inserted by selecting it from the full emoji picker
: when the emoji is inserted due to an automatic conversion from an ascii representation (e.g. :) =>
: when the mention is inserted by selecting a user from the mention typeahead
: when the insertion comes from an automatic exact nickname match
: when the mention is inserted on request by the integrator
There are enough events being sent on the elements channel to cover everything - can revisit later if necessary
This event fires when a link/card is actually inserted. Bringing up the link dialog is a UI event outlined above.
: The user picked a link from the link auto complete menu
: Typing/pasting a URL into the url field into the link dialog.
sends inputMethod:manual when user creates it in dialog.
This event fires when a smart link is actually inserted replacing a normal blue link.
: when a supported URL has been pasted and is supported by Smart Links
: when a supported URL has been typed manually and is supported by Smart Links
an issue key or similar has been autoconverted to a smart link
subjectId is the node that you are pasting
richText means general formatting of paragraphs, lists, headings, inline formats, etc.
Source is a best effort attempt at categorising where the content came from.
